minority_owned_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] owned by minority A minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans.
minority_owned_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

non_minority_owned_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] owned by non-minority A non-minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members not of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans.
non_minority_owned_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

minority_owned_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] owned by minority A minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans.
